doc.title: Omagh the Legacy: Claire and Stephen's Story
doc.plot: On August 15th, 1998, the worst single atrocity of the Northern Ireland troubles was perpetrated when a bomb exploded in the friendly market town of Omagh. 29 people were killed and 300 injured in that barbaric act. Narrated by Liam Neeson, this documentary follows the painful road to recovery of two Omagh children, Claire Gallagher, aged 15, who lost her sight, and 10 year old Stephen Coyle who suffered severe internal injuries.
